ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it for a lot of reasons.
I would recommend this course to other students. I learned a lot about African history and how the environment impacted that history and was impacted by that history.
I would recommend the course. It is a great introduction to environmental history.
This course is about getting a broad view of how African History has been constructed.
It is a straightforward class, not overly stressful, and a good change of pace from other African Studies seminars.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course introduced me to environmental history as a discipline. It sparked my interest.
This helped me establish a working knowledge of African History. I thought this class helped me to comprehend how people misused environmental information.
Gave me a good background in historical research methods.
